gurmukhi: qurMgin piRQm aucwir kY irp Air AMq aucwr ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwr ]463]
transliteration: Turanad(i) Pritham Oucdaar(i) Kai Tip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||463||
translation: Uttering the word “Turangni in the beginning and saying “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak ate formed.463.

gurmukhi: hXnI Awid aucwr kY hw pd AMq bKwn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu buiDvwn ]464]
transliteration: Hayaniaadh Ouchaar Kai Haa Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Lehu Budh(i)vaan||464||
translation: Adding the word “Haa” with the word “Hayani”, O wise men ! the names of tupak are formed.464.

gurmukhi: Arbin Awid bKwnIAY irp Air AMiq aucwr ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwir ]465]
transliteration: Arban(i) Aadh Bakhaaneeai Rip Ar(i) Ant(i) Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Se Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabisuddaar(i)||465||
translation: Saying the word “Arbani” in the beginning and adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are formed.465.

gurmukhi: ikMkwxI piRQmY aucir kY irp pd AMiq aucwr ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwr ]466]
transliteration: Kinkaaniprithmai Ouchar(i) Kai Rip Pad Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||466||
translation: Saying “Kinkani” primarily and then uttering the word “Ripu”, the names of Tupak are formed.466.

gurmukhi: AsunI Awid aucwrIAY AMq Sbd Air dIn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ pRbIn ]467]
transliteration: Asouniaadh Oucdareeai Ant Shabad Ar(i) Deen|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Samajh Prabeen||467||
translation: Saying the word “Ashivani” in the beginning and then adding the word “Ari” at the end, O skilful people ! the names of Tupak may be comprehended.467.

gurmukhi: suAwsin Awid bKwnIAY irp Air pd ky dIn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN suGr lIjIAhu cIn ]468]
transliteration: Suaasan(i) Aadh Bakhaaneeai Rip Ar(i) Pad Ke Deen|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Soughar Leejeeauh Cheen||468||
translation: Saying the word “Shavani” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are recognized.468.

gurmukhi: AwDin Awid aucwir kY irp pd AMq bKwn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu miqvwn ]469]
transliteration: Aadhan(i) Aadh Oucdaar(i) Kai Rip Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Lehu Mar(i)vaan||469||
translation: Saying the word “Aadhani” in the beginning and adding the words “Ripu Ari”, O wise men ! the names of tupak are formed.469.

gurmukhi: pRBxI Awid aucwr kY irp pd AMq bKwn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN cIn lyhu miqvwn ]470]
transliteration: Prabhniaadh Ouchaar Kai Rip Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Cheen Lehu Mat(i)vaan||470||
translation: Saying the word “Prabhuni” in the beginning and then adding the word “Ripu” at the end, O wise men ! the names of Tupak are formed.470.

gurmukhi: Awid BUpxI Sbd kih irp Air AMq aucwr ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu su kib suDwr ]471]
transliteration: Aadh Bhoopan(i) Shabad Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Se Hot Hain Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||471||
translation: Uttering the word “Bhoopani” in the beginning and the adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the names of Tupak are know correctly.471.

gurmukhi: Awid eIsxI Sbd kih irp Air pd ky dIn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN suGr lIjIAhu cIn ]472]
transliteration: Aadh Eesanishabad Kah(i) Rip Ar(i) Pad Ke Deen|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Soughar Leejeeauh Cheen||472||
translation: Uttering the word “Ishani” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari”, the names of Tupak are formed.472.

gurmukhi: Awid sOfnI Sbd kih irp bhur aucwr ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur ibcwr ]473]
transliteration: Aadh Saudanishabad Kah(i) Rip Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Chatur Bichaar||473||
translation: Uttering the word “Saudani” in the beginning and then adding “ripu Ari”, O wise people ! the names of Tupak come to the fore.473.

gurmukhi: piRQm S`qRxI aucrIAY irp Air AMq aucwr ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur ibcwr ]474]
transliteration: Pritham Shattraniouchreeci Rip Ar(i) Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Haiaa Leejoh Chatur Bichaar||474||
translation: Uttering the word “Shatruni” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari”, the names of Tupak are formed.474.

gurmukhi: skl CqR ky nwm lY nIkih irpih bKwn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hYN lIjhu smJ sujwn ]475]
transliteration: Sakal Chhatra Ke Naam Lai Neekah(i) Ripah(i) Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Samajh Sujaan||475||
translation: Naming all the canopies and uttering the word “Nee” and then adding the word “Ripuhi”, the names of Tupak continue to be evolved.475.

gurmukhi: piRQm C`qRnI Sbd aucir irp Air AMq bKwn ]nwm qupk ky hoq hY cIn lyhu miqvwn ]476]
transliteration: Pritham Chhattranishabad Ouchar(i) Rip Ar(i) Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Toupak Ke Hot Hai Cheen Leh(u) Mat(i)vaan||476||
translation: Saying the word “Chhatrani” in the beginning and then adding “Ripu Ari” at the end, the wise men recognize the names of Tupak.476.
